instruction: I am Paul Henriot (CustomerID 85) from Vins et alcools Chevalier. Please create a new order for me with today's date, assigned to employee Andrew Fuller (EmployeeID 2), using United Package (ShipperID 2). The order should include 12 units of ProductID 1 ('Chai') and 20 units of ProductID 2 ('Chang'). Ensure all details match exactly.

actions.sql: INSERT INTO Orders (CustomerID, EmployeeID, OrderDate, ShipperID) VALUES (85, 2, CURRENT_DATE, 2);
SELECT OrderID FROM Orders WHERE CustomerID=85 AND EmployeeID=2 AND OrderDate=CURRENT_DATE AND ShipperID=2 ORDER BY OrderID DESC LIMIT 1;
INSERT INTO OrderDetails (OrderID, ProductID, Quantity) VALUES ({new_order_id}, 1, 12);
INSERT INTO OrderDetails (OrderID, ProductID, Quantity) VALUES ({new_order_id}, 2, 20);

instruction: I'm Roland Mendel from Graz, Austria (CustomerID 20). I want to place a new order today with Nancy Davolio (EmployeeID 1) for 40 units of 'Chang' (ProductID 2) and 30 units of 'Chef Anton's Gumbo Mix' (ProductID 5). Please use Speedy Express (ShipperID 1) for shipping. Confirm the new Order ID and that both product line items have been added.

actions.sql: INSERT INTO Orders (CustomerID, EmployeeID, OrderDate, ShipperID) VALUES (20, 1, CURRENT_DATE, 1);
SELECT MAX(OrderID) AS NewOrderID FROM Orders WHERE CustomerID = 20 AND EmployeeID = 1;
INSERT INTO OrderDetails (OrderID, ProductID, Quantity) VALUES (<NewOrderID>, 2, 40);
INSERT INTO OrderDetails (OrderID, ProductID, Quantity) VALUES (<NewOrderID>, 5, 30);

instruction: I am Carlos González from LILA-Supermercado (Customer ID 46). Today, June 18, 2024, I want to place a new order handled by employee Janet Leverling (Employee ID 3) via Federal Shipping (Shipper ID 3). For Customer ID 46, please add: 15 units of Product ID 12 and 24 units of Product ID 17. Confirm my order placement.

actions.sql: INSERT INTO Orders (CustomerID, EmployeeID, OrderDate, ShipperID) VALUES (46, 3, '2024-06-18', 3);
SELECT OrderID FROM Orders WHERE CustomerID = 46 AND EmployeeID = 3 AND OrderDate = '2024-06-18' AND ShipperID = 3 ORDER BY OrderID DESC LIMIT 1;
INSERT INTO OrderDetails (OrderID, ProductID, Quantity) VALUES ([OrderID from previous step], 12, 15);
INSERT INTO OrderDetails (OrderID, ProductID, Quantity) VALUES ([OrderID from previous step], 17, 24);

error_info:
<result>Error: no such column: OrderID from previous step
</result>

instruction: I am Pirkko Koskitalo from Wartian Herkku (CustomerID 87). Please create a new order for 10 units of ProductID 12, assigned to EmployeeID 8, shipped via ShipperID 1, with order date '2024-06-14'. Confirm my customer details match CustomerID 87 before proceeding.

actions.sql: SELECT CustomerID FROM Customers WHERE CustomerID = 87 AND CustomerName = 'Wartian Herkku' AND ContactName = 'Pirkko Koskitalo';
INSERT INTO Orders (CustomerID, EmployeeID, OrderDate, ShipperID) VALUES (87, 8, '2024-06-14', 1);
SELECT OrderID FROM Orders WHERE CustomerID = 87 AND EmployeeID = 8 AND OrderDate = '2024-06-14' AND ShipperID = 1 ORDER BY OrderID DESC LIMIT 1;
INSERT INTO OrderDetails (OrderID, ProductID, Quantity) VALUES (<ORDER_ID_FROM_PREVIOUS_STEP>, 12, 10);

instruction: You are Pascale Cartrain, the contact for Suprêmes délices (CustomerID 76). You wish to split your existing order (OrderID 10302) so that Alice Mutton (ProductID 17, Quantity 40, OrderDetailID 145) is shipped separately from Ipoh Coffee. Please create a new order under CustomerID 76 with EmployeeID 4 and ShipperID 2 using today's date, move only that item to the new order via OrderDetailID 145, and remove it from the original order.

actions.sql: INSERT INTO Orders (CustomerID, EmployeeID, OrderDate, ShipperID) VALUES (76, 4, CURRENT_DATE, 2);
SELECT MAX(OrderID) AS NewOrderID FROM Orders WHERE CustomerID = 76;
UPDATE OrderDetails SET OrderID = {NewOrderID} WHERE OrderDetailID = 145 AND ProductID = 17 AND Quantity = 40;

instruction: I am Pirkko Koskitalo from Wartian Herkku (CustomerID 87) in Oulu, Finland. I want to place a new order for ProductID 8 with Quantity 25 today (OrderDate '2024-06-12'), managed by Employee Janet Leverling (EmployeeID 3), shipped via Federal Shipping (ShipperID 3). Please process this order and confirm the new OrderID along with the product details.

actions.sql: SELECT * FROM Customers WHERE CustomerID = 87
INSERT INTO Orders (CustomerID, EmployeeID, OrderDate, ShipperID) VALUES (87, 3, '2024-06-12', 3)
SELECT OrderID FROM Orders WHERE CustomerID = 87 AND EmployeeID = 3 AND OrderDate = '2024-06-12' AND ShipperID = 3 ORDER BY OrderID DESC LIMIT 1
INSERT INTO OrderDetails (OrderID, ProductID, Quantity) VALUES (<OrderID_from_above>, 8, 25)
SELECT o.OrderID, od.ProductID, od.Quantity FROM Orders o JOIN OrderDetails od ON o.OrderID = od.OrderID WHERE o.OrderID = <OrderID_from_above>

instruction: Hi, this is Pirkko Koskitalo from Wartian Herkku (CustomerID 87). Please create a new order with these details: CustomerID 87, initial EmployeeID 5, ShipperID 1, OrderDate '2024-06-17'. Add 30 units of ProductID 15. Then update this same order to final EmployeeID 8 and ShipperID 2 (United Package). Confirm the final EmployeeID and ShipperID for this new order.

actions.sql: INSERT INTO Orders (CustomerID, EmployeeID, OrderDate, ShipperID) VALUES (87, 5, '2024-06-17', 1);
SELECT MAX(OrderID) AS NewOrderID FROM Orders WHERE CustomerID = 87 AND OrderDate = '2024-06-17';
INSERT INTO OrderDetails (OrderID, ProductID, Quantity) VALUES (NEW_ORDER_ID, 15, 30);
UPDATE Orders SET EmployeeID = 8, ShipperID = 2 WHERE OrderID = NEW_ORDER_ID;
SELECT EmployeeID, ShipperID FROM Orders WHERE OrderID = NEW_ORDER_ID;
